newsitem.title: ISRAEL: RESEARCH ALERT - Tadiran Tel 1998 EPS.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Tadiran Tel 1998 EPS.

text.p: Lehman Brothers on Wednesday forecast Israel's Tadiran Telecommunications 1998 earnings per share (EPS) would be $2.04, against an estimated $1.75 in 1997.
Tadiran Telecom earned $1.74 a share in 1996.
Lehman maintained its 2-Outperform rating for the company.
"Following an impressive performance in 1996 beating expectations, we continue to believe 1997 may represent a transition year," analyst Tim Luke wrote in a report.

The report said it was expected that lower sales to state- controlled phone company Bezeq Israel Telecom would offset strong export growth in 1997. Lehman said it expected stronger growth to resume in 1998.
"We consider that Tadiran Telecom's shares may benefit looking forward as investors focus on steady sequential growth in 1997 and an improving outlook in 1998," it said.
Tadiran Telecom is a subsidiary of Israeli electronics giant Tadiran Ltd.
